title: Implicit Learning and Theory-Based Practical Design for Skill Acquisition in Athletes with Disabilities (Swimming)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Swim Coaching Theory and Experience in Training Design
context.additional_context: Strengthening competencies in designing customized technical training for athletes with disabilities, targeting current swimming coaches and exercise rehabilitation specialists

learning_goals: Design a swimming skills training program for individuals with disabilities using implicit learning techniques (analogy/metaphor cueing).
Develop at least three training scenarios applying attentional focus theory (external vs. holistic focus).
Implement a complex skill training module considering contextual interference theory and evaluate its effectiveness.

resources: Database of swimming training cases for people with disabilities

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
